noun.description: A straight line or plane that touches a curve or curved surface at a point, but if extended does not cross it at that point.
A completely different line of thought or action.
examples: he quickly went off on a tangent about wrestling

noun.description: The trigonometric function that is equal to the ratio of the sides (other than the hypotenuse) opposite and adjacent to an angle in a right triangle.

adjective.description: (of a line or plane) touching, but not intersecting, a curve or curved surface.

origin: Late 16th century (in tangent (sense 3 of the noun) and as an adjective): from Latin tangent- touching, from the verb tangere.
